chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

(i, PUSH x b :: nil) <sc P -> P // (1 + i, v[(b :: v#>x)/x]) ->> st -> P // (i, v) ->> st

subcode_cons_inj : forall (X : Type) (i : nat) (ρ δ : X) (P : code X), (i, ρ :: nil) <sc P -> (i, δ :: nil) <sc P -> ρ = δ
in_bsm_sss_pop_E : forall (n i : nat) (x : pos n) (p q : nat) (v : vec (list bool) n), v#>x = nil -> bsm_sss (POP x p q) (i, v) (q, v)
bsm_sss_stall : forall (P : nat * list (bsm_instr n)) (s : nat * vec (list bool) n), sss_step_stall (bsm_sss (n:=n)) P s -> out_code (fst s) P
subcode_cons_invert_left : forall (X : Type) (Q : code X) (i : nat) (I : X) (l : list X), (i, I :: l) <sc Q -> (i, I :: nil) <sc Q /\ (S i, l) <sc Q
subcode_app_invert_right : forall (X : Type) (j : nat) (Q1 Q2 : list X) (i : nat) (I : X), (i, I :: nil) <sc (j, Q1 ++ Q2) -> (i, I :: nil) <sc (j, Q1) \/ (i, I :: nil) <sc (length Q1 + j, Q2)
in_code_subcode : forall (X : Type) (i : nat) (P : code X), in_code i P -> exists a : X, (i, a :: nil) <sc P

sss_step_subcode_inv : forall (instr : Set) (data : Type) (one_step : instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop) (P : nat * list instr) (ii : instr) (st st' : nat * data), (fst st, ii :: nil) <sc P -> sss_step one_step P st st' -> one_step ii st st'
subcode_cons : forall (X : Type) (P : code X) (n : nat) (x : X) (l : list X), P <sc (1 + n, l) -> P <sc (n, x :: l)
subcode_cons_invert_right : forall (X : Type) (j : nat) (J : X) (Q : list X) (i : nat) (I : X), (i, I :: nil) <sc (j, J :: Q) -> i = j /\ I = J \/ (i, I :: nil) <sc (S j, Q)
sss_stall_step_0 : forall (instr : Set) (data : Type) (one_step : instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop) (ii : instr) (P : nat * list instr) (q : nat) (st st' : nat * data), (fst st, ii :: nil) <sc P -> sss_stall one_step ii st -> sss_steps one_step P q st st' -> q = 0 /\ st = st'
sss_step_stall_inv : forall (instr : Set) (data : Type) (one_step : instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop) (P : nat * list instr) (st : nat * data), sss_step_stall one_step P st -> {ii : instr | (fst st, ii :: nil) <sc P /\ sss_stall one_step ii st} + {out_code (fst st) P}

```coq
intros st'.
apply in_bsm_sss_push.
apply H.
Qed.
